G-grave news, kupo!!!
Unknown individuals donning priceless samurai armor from the Far East have been wreaking havoc!!!${prompt}
Furthermore, these shady individuals claim the armor was borrowed by the MHMU, kupo!${prompt}
Please lend us a hand, brave adventurer!

This new weapon, the ${item-singular: 0[2]}, was developed as a countermeasure for serious situations such as this, kupo. It has been designed with the ability to absorb malicious auras emitted by enemies. ${prompt}

We want you to use it to absorb malice from those wacky samurai wannabes, and then plant this ${item-singular: 0[2]} near where they fall. By doing so, you can further weaken the insidious individuals inside the armor, kupo!${prompt}
To plant the ${item-singular: 0[2]}, all you have to do is trade it to the ground near a fallen fiend. You'll get a reward that matches the amount of malice absorbed, kupo!${prompt}
When you plant the ${item-singular: 0[2]} into the ground, all malice absorbed inside will be purified by the land, kupo!${prompt}
Alright then!
Take this ${item-singular: 0[2]} and get to work on those vile villains! I'll be preparing your special reward, kupo!${prompt}
Equip this ${item-singular: 0[2]}, and have a nomad moogle outside town cast special moogle magic upon it. Be sure to absorb as much malice as you can from those scoundrels, kupo!${prompt}
Good job, kupo! You sure showed them who's boss!
Thanks to you, we were able to avoid a diplomatic disaster with the Far East, kupo.${prompt}
A handful of no-good nomad moogles and Goblins were conspiring to take over the MHMU, wilfully assuming false identities in order to obtain the armor and frame us, kupo!${prompt}
Then, they hired thieves to wear the armor and do their dirty work!${prompt}
But thanks to all you courageous adventurers, the MHMU is safe and sound, kupo!${prompt}

Bastok, San d'Oria--none of that is important! Don't you understand? Surely you have someone who you would die to protect, no matter the consequences?${prompt}
!!!${prompt}
For me, those people are Phillone and Millechairale. Now please, just go!${prompt}
Wait...
There is one way to save all of us...${prompt}
I see what she means now.
The most important thing is understanding...${prompt}
Vijartal?${prompt}
Do not resist the Temple Knights when they come. Leave everything to me.${prompt}
You have nowhere left to run! Hand over the Scepter Royaulais!${prompt}

Roido, you have made me realize that Bastokers are not to be so easily dismissed. There is something to Prince Fellenant's reasoning after all. I see now why I cannot allow him to be assassinated.${prompt}
It is just like the last time... These caves are responding in some way to the Pierre Errante. Did you know that this place was once known as the “Shrine of Endless Travels”?${prompt}
Vijartal...?${prompt}
There is nothing to fear. Please let Phillone know that I need no thanks; I already have my reward. I am the Obsidian Bolt, such deeds are my reason for living...!${prompt}
We have you now, thief! Surrender quietly!${prompt}
He's vanished! Where is the knight that accompanied you? Sorcery...!?${prompt}
Wait...this is the Scepter Royaulais!${prompt}
Now we have the thief and the scepter in our possession.${prompt}
...${prompt}
I have my suspicions that you aided the thief in his crime, but for the moment I will let that small detail pass. We will see what the villain confesses, however.${prompt}
This can't be happening. I've failed to protect Millechairale...${prompt}
Sir Elmemague has taken the suspect to the chateau for questioning. It's back to regular training drills for us.${prompt}

We have received a report from Sir Elmemague that the suspect we apprehended wasn't the criminal after all. We must be ready to send word to the chateau if any other suspicious characters are sighted.${prompt}
Thanks to our effective training drills, we were able to capture the new suspect with little trouble. Although I do wonder where that other knight disappeared to...${prompt}
The suspect appears to have taken refuge within Ordelle's Caves. We will follow our training drills and stick to our posts!${prompt}
Our rigorous training drills have shown their worth. That preparation honed the skills we needed to handle the situation this day.${prompt}
Another suspect has been discovered in Ordelle's Caves! We must be ready to move at a moment's notice!
Take care to stay out of our way.${prompt}
We have succeeded not once, but twice at capturing a suspected criminal. I'm certain that this will be the site for developing even more effective training exercises in the future.${prompt}
I have spoken with Sir Elmemague. Narvecaint is currently monitoring the suspect's movements from the entrance to the caves.${prompt}
Well, I suppose we can regard this as an adequate performance. It will still be necessary to further refine our soldiers' training...
However, this was an excellent opportunity for the knights to practice their skills in a real-life situation.${prompt}
Another chance to test the effectiveness of our training in almost exactly the same setting! This time, I expect perfect coordination and execution from my men.${prompt}
Hmm, there is still room for improvement. They need to work on communication to facilitate speedier responses... Lady Curilla will not be pleased.${prompt}
There is nothing out of the ordinary here.${prompt}

Why, Cid. What business do you have here today?${prompt}
Well, if it isn't little Wolfgang. How have you been?${prompt}
We're here to check out the Crystal Line. Recently I've been receiving some very strange readings from this area.${prompt}
According to the data retrieved by a Republican party that visited here last month, the once stable energy flow has begun to fluctuate.${prompt}
I've never seen such high readings...${prompt}

The flow of energy is so overwhelming that the Telepoint you see over there was shattered to pieces! And now there are reports that a giant beast appeared over the sea, just to the north of Delkfutt's Tower.${prompt}
I have a bad feeling that these two events are connected, and that they're warning us of something worse to come.${prompt}
I understand that research inclines you to pursue these matters. However, I ask that you leave the investigation to the Duchy.${prompt}
Eh?
So the Duchy knows the cause of all these strange phenomena?${prompt}
Not exactly.

We cannot allow any more accidents. The damage to Vana'diel would be great if we were to lose such an important engineer as you, Cid.${prompt}
Hah!
Let me guess... The scientists back in Jeuno told you to get rid of all those who got in their way.${prompt}
Who do they think they are!?
Come to think of it, I have good reason to believe that it's those lunatics that are causing all this trouble!${prompt}
Wh-what is going on!?${prompt}
A moment, ${name-player}!${prompt}
Common rumor has it that one can meet here with the terrestrial avatar Carbuncle.
Could this be true...?${prompt}
Carbuncle, bringer of rainbows!
I am Tenzen of the Far East, sent here across the seas at the behest of Phoenix!${prompt}
The Keeper of the Apocalypse has come to Vana'diel, and four of the mothercrystals are besieged by darkness!${prompt}
Yet in the face of this crisis, Bahamut and Diabolos do nothing to defend them.${prompt}
Diabolos draws souls into his dreamworld to shelter people from the Emptiness.${prompt}
And Bahamut rallies his wyrms for the destruction of every last person on Vana'diel in the name of some ancient pact!${prompt}
Carbuncle.
We all carry the curse of Promathia within us...${prompt}
And it is not within our power to lift this bane...${prompt}
But I cannot accept this as justification for genocide!
We were born as a part of fate's design, and we will live the lives we have been given!${prompt}
You, who have brought the soul of Phoenix across the waves.
And you, who carries the blessings of the mothercrystal.${prompt}
You have finally come into contact with the will of Promathia...${prompt}
I knew that even should the past be ground into dust, there would come a time when people would uncover the truth.${prompt}
No matter how tightly sealed, as long as it exists alongside the mothercrystal, Promathia's will shall one day awaken.${prompt}
That is why I have come to guide you.
Guide you to the power of the slumbering gods.${prompt}
As many people as possible must possess this strength to prevent the awakening of the Twilight God.${prompt}
The slumbering gods...
You speak of the great avatars that dream away their existence in every corner of Vana'diel?${prompt}
I sense that Phoenix does not approve of my actions.${prompt}
He who tries to save the world and he who tries to save mankind... Bahamut and Diabolos would also surely oppose me if they knew of my plans.${prompt}
Every time the power of the avatars is granted to a person, it hastens the awakening of the sleeping gods.${prompt}
If the siphoning of energy continues, the boundaries of the crystal world they protect will shatter, and their true forms will manifest upon this world of Vana'diel.${prompt}
And then a furious battle will ensue between the terrestrial avatars and the newly awakened gods.${prompt}
But I believe that this is the only option remaining to prevent Promathia's rebirth.${prompt}
The awakening of Promathia draws near.${prompt}
With the Keeper of the Apocalypse now among us, all that remains is for the Gates of Paradise to be opened...${prompt}
I don't understand.
Has not the pursuit for the Gates of Paradise all been the result of Promathia's curse?${prompt}
If so, then everything has been for the purpose of awakening the Twilight God...${prompt}
Carbuncle!
Destroying his minion ourselves is the only way to save the children of Altana!${prompt}
I beg of you to lend us the strength we need!
Please tell us where to find the Keeper of the Apocalypse!${prompt}
You shine so brilliantly...
I know that guiding light well.${prompt}
It is the light standing at your side, merging with your own, that so fills you with hope.${prompt}
Very well.
I will grant you my assistance.${prompt}
You will help us!?${prompt}
Thirty years ago, I sensed the birth of the Keeper of the Apocalypse.${prompt}
After a number of years the presence faded, and I can no longer sense its location.${prompt}
However, the fiery bird of resurrection will continue to lead your steps on this journey.${prompt}
And that is why I will lend my strength to Phoenix's diminished soul...${prompt}
You have our thanks!
Bringer of rainbows, I am delirious with joy at your words!${prompt}
Do not rejoice just yet, Tenzen.
The energy I will share with Phoenix does not exist here.${prompt}
It can be found in the city built by the Kuluu on the outskirts of the Zilartian capital.
A place known as Pso'Xja.${prompt}
The power we granted the Kuluu in ancient times should still be sealed within that city.${prompt}
${name-player}.

Kupopopo～!
This is terrible!
Some sneaky scoundrels have swiped the armor we brought in for the Feast of Swords...again, kupo!${prompt}

As you probably already know, the villains wearing the armor are invulnerable to normal weapons! And as if that wasn't enough, they're surrounded by a powerful aura that prevents them from being attacked at all, kupo!${prompt}
But never fear!
The nomad moogles have also developed a magic that will annul that anti-attack aura, so be sure to pay them a visit while wearing the weapon before you engage the enemy, kupo.${prompt}
But be warned--this magic has the side effect of preventing you from attacking any other monster for three whole Vana'dielian days, kupo!${prompt}
And that's not all!
This time we want to make sure that the wretched thieves have a hard time coming back, kupo!${prompt}
You see, even if you take one of them down, the power of the armor will slowly restore his health, and before you know it, the scoundrel will be back up to full health!${prompt}

That's why we want you to plant (${color: 5}trade${color: 1}) your ${item-singular: 0[2]} or ${item-singular: 1[2]} into the ground near a fallen fiend. It will create a ward that should slow the equipment's regenerative properties, making it easier for you to defeat them again and again, kupo!${prompt}
Just remember that the further away you travel from the ward, the weaker it becomes. We recommend staying in the same ${color: 5}area${color: 1} for best results.${prompt}
Alright. Here's your ${item-singular: 0[2]}. Now you're ready to do battle, kupo!${prompt}

Oh, and you'll find that the prizes we have for you this time are even better than the last ones. You might even be one of the lucky adventurers who wins a spiffy, new... Ah, you'll just have to see it to believe it, kupo!${prompt}
Now, if you want to cross swords with the invincible interlopers, equip ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} or ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]} and talk to a nomad moogle, kupo!${prompt}
Vana'diel is under attack by villains in our stolen samurai armor! Help the moogles in each nation defeat this menace, kupo!${prompt}
We've mixed up some moogle magic to crack that aura, but you'll need to equip a special weapon to even cause a scratch, kupo! Equip, I tell you! Equiiiiiip!${prompt}
Th-that ${item-singular: 0[2]}...
It may be just the thing for whacking those wacky samurai! Hold still while I work my moogle magic, kupo!${prompt}
Oh, just don't forget to place the ward with your ${item-singular: 0[2]} when you've defeated one!${prompt}
You'll be able to really hurt those harbingers of harm with ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}. Now hold still while I work my moogle magic, kupo!${prompt}
Oh, just don't forget to place the ward with your ${item-singular: 0[2]} or your ${item-singular: 1[2]} when you've defeated one!${prompt}
And whatever you do, don't wander too far from the area; your weary wards will weaken, kupo!${prompt}

No, no, no! That ${item-singular: 1[2]} is way too sharp! Just think of the damage it will deal to the poor armor! Now go get yourself ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]} or ${article} ${item-article: 2[2]} and hurry back, kupo!${prompt}
Well done!
On to the next one, kupo!${prompt}
That thief has already been weakened by a ward. Try to find one that hasn't, kupo!${prompt}
Wonderful! Here's your reward, kupo!
If you're still up for it, why don't you go out and whack yourself some more?${prompt}
Unbelievable! Now, maybe those Far Eastern traders won't mix us up into moogle mincemeat! Here's your reward, kupo!${prompt}
I-I'm speechless! We didn't think anyone could match wits with that Mithra menace! Here's your reward, kupo!${prompt}
The shadow of the thief still lingers within the armor...${prompt}
The thief's shadow has almost disappeared completely.${prompt}

Read instructions.
“Elite training” is a section of the Field Manual which caters to dauntless adventurers who wish to engage in a more grueling test of their mettle.${prompt}
To participate in elite training regimes, you must acquire chapter transcripts, for which tabs are required.${prompt}
Trading ${item-plural: 35[2]}, gil, or a piece of equipment at designated locations (while in possession of a chapter transcript) will trigger the commencement of your training.${prompt}
Traded items will not be returned to you. You will, however, be furnished with rewards of correlating value upon the successful completion of each elite training regime.${prompt}
Even within elite training, there are regimes of varying difficulty. The trade limit for each succeeding chapter will be greater than the last, and the training objective more challenging.
For safety reasons, all participants are recommended to be well prepared.${prompt}

Lastly, we at the A.M.A.N. recognize the importance of rest and recuperation as part of a healthy adventuring lifestyle. Therefore, a mandatory cool-down period will be imposed upon all adventurers following the completion of an elite training regime. Until this time has elapsed, you will be unable to undertake further training, even if a chapter transcript is in your possession.${prompt}

Greetings, adventurer!
You've heard the tale of the mog tablets, haven't you?

${choice: 0}[Greetings/Happy Vana'versary], my adventuring friend!

You are truly a friend to all mooglekind, kupo!${prompt}
Oh no! What a shame, kupo!
The mog tablets that were recovered have been scattered to the ends of Vana'diel once more...${prompt}

What's a mog tablet!? What's a mog tablet, you say!?
Why, only the most awesome, amazing artifact in the annals of moogle history, that's what, kupo!${prompt}
There's eleven of them in all, to be exact, scattered to the far reaches of Vana'diel and just waiting to be discovered by brave adventurers like you!${prompt}
What happens if you find them? I thought you'd never ask, kupo!

Each tablet is inscribed with an ancient moogle poem of joy, and legend has it that if all are found, the ancient moogle magic of King Kupofried the Great will be released once more, spreading joy and happiness through all the land!${prompt}
We explorer moogles have made it our life's work to recover the tablets and unlock their powers.
But with these short legs and little-bitty wings, we can't do it alone, kupo!${prompt}
There! I've whipped up a spell that will instantly transport any tablets you find back here to me.
Come back if you find anything, and happy exploring, kupo!${prompt}
Just sit right back and I'll tell you the tale, kupo.
Many, many ages past, we moogles had our own glorious kingdom.
It was truly the peak of moogle civilization, a veritable golden age for all mooglekind!${prompt}
The seventh king of this great nation was the wise and kindly King Kupofried, a masterful magician famed as the father of the fantastic moogle magic that survives to this very day, kupo!${prompt}
In his later years, King Kupofried embarked on what would become the greatest work of his illustrious reign.
Seeking to pass down the prosperity of his kingdom to future generations, he inscribed eleven incantations of moogle joy and happiness onto eleven stone tablets.${prompt}
Sadly, the kindly king's intentions went unappreciated by his selfish sons and daughters, and many a fierce feud broke out over who would inherit these relics, kupo...${prompt}
King Kupofried was greatly dismayed.
How could the poems that he had composed out of pure love and joy become the root of such strife?${prompt}
In his despair, the king commanded his minion bats to scatter the tablets to the far corners of the world, where they would be seen by moogle eyes no more.${prompt}
“Alas! I only wanted my children to be happy, kupo,” he lamented, and flew away on his tiny yet majestic wings, never to be seen in his kingdom again.${prompt}
Left without its wise monarch, the once-glorious moogle kingdom fractured into warring tribes, falling into unrest...and, eventually, ruin.
A tragic tale, don't you think, kupo?${prompt}
We explorer moogles are the proud descendants of King Kupofried, living only to bring our last great monarch's unrealized dream to fruition.
We will--we must!--find the mog tablets and bring true joy and happiness to this world!${prompt}
Let's see...
Here's a list of all the located tablets, kupo!${prompt}

No tablet has been discovered there yet.
It's not too late for you to stake your claim, kupo!${prompt}
Oh, glorious day!
All eleven mog tablets have been recovered and restored to their rightful place at the altar of King Kupofried!${prompt}
Can you feel the ancient moogle magic in the air?
You can now bask in the benefits of this Super Kupower...${prompt}
“Thrifty Transit”!
A special treat for the cost-conscious adventurer!
For a limited time, all survival guide costs are eliminated, and you are able to teleport between nearby cities for a small fee, kupo!${prompt}
“Martial Master”!
As an added bonus to your Signet, combat skills will increase more rapidly! Your magic and automaton skills will be boosted, too!${prompt}
“Blood of the Vampyr”!
Signets have been boosted with the abilities of Regeneration and Refresh!${prompt}
“Treasure Hound”!
With Signet in effect, you will now be able to sniff out more treasure and gil! Great riches surely await you, kupo!${prompt}
“Artisan's Advantage”!
Good news for aspiring artisans, kupo! When receiving advanced image support, the chance of your ingredients being lost in a failed synthesis attempt has been drastically reduced!${prompt}
“Myriad Mystery Boxes”!
What's this, kupo? Mysterious boxes have been sighted all over the realm!
What genius could have devised such commendable creations?${prompt}
“Dilatory Digestion”!
Not content to be left behind, brown magic slides back out for another go, kupo!
Now you can be what you eat for twice as long and save on all those trips to your local merchant.${prompt}
“Boundary Buster”!
Trust in Signet and you can never go wrong, kupo!
It's time to take to the field and vanquish a veritable army of enemies, for any Conquest Points you receive will be duly doubled!${prompt}
“Bountiful Bazaar”!
Trade routes are bustling with unprecedented traffic and peddlers' carts are overflowing with objects now that regional goods are available to merchants across the realm, kupo!${prompt}
“Swift Shoes”!
This is just the ticket for today's busy adventurer! For a limited time, provided that you're fully rested and healed, your legs will carry you with the speed of a chocobo!${prompt}
“Crystal Caboodle”!
Signet is now better than ever! Collect crystals from beastmen-controlled areas...and maybe even clusters from other areas!${prompt}
${prompt}
Be warned that our moogle magic is concentrated around this altar.
If you venture to far-off lands, the Super Kupowers will be unable to protect you...${prompt}
What? What about the past, you say?
Of course the magic won't travel through time.
What a strange question, kupo...${prompt}
But not an altogether pointless, one. The powers of thirtfy transit do seem to apply across the space-time continuum, kupo.${prompt}
The whole system is filled with mysteries.${prompt}
Oh, it's you! It's really you!
The brave adventurer who discovered one of our mog tablets!${prompt}
It's a pleasure, an honor to meet you, kupo!
We have a special prize to reward you for your efforts.
If you'll just sign right here...${prompt}
Sign for the moogle?
${selection-lines}
Sure.
I don't think so.${prompt}
Oh, thank you, ${choice-player-gender}[Mister/Miss]...${name-player}!
A truly heroic name, kupo!${prompt}

Hi there! I'm ${related-entity}, your friendly neighborhood smile sergeant!
I'm in charge of running the ${choice: 0}[beginner/intermediate/advanced] level Smilebringer Boot Camp in this area.${prompt}
I'd be thrilled to answer any questions you might have...and of course, sign you up, too!
You'd like that, wouldn't you? Hmmm?${prompt}
What will you do?
${selection-lines}
Undertake training.
Hear an explanation.
What's the qualifying time?
What's the fastest time?
Nothing.${prompt}
Fantastic! But, oh...it seems you don't have ${keyitem-article: 1[2]}. Well, that's just too bad!
It'd be my pleasure! Here goes nothing! Ahem!

The Smilebringer Boot Camp was established for two purposes, the first being the ongoing training and conditioning of smilebringers. The second--and this is where you come in, yay!--is for us to scout hopefuls from the adventurer community to join our jovial ranks!${prompt}
The population of vicious monsters has grown in recent years, you see. And because of this, more smilebringers were being--<gasp!>--injured in the line of duty than ever before.${prompt}
But we weren't going to take that sitting down, no siree.
The day we smilebringers stop doing our job--that is, bringing smiles--is the day the world ends!${prompt}
Whatever the predicament, and no matter the size of the ruszor-inflicted gash wound, we will--we must--pull through...for the sake of the children!${prompt}
With these heart-warming ideals in mind, the Smilebringer Boot Camp was established. Ta-da!
Smilebringers graduating from this camp are better equipped to meet the ever-changing needs of these unstable times we live in.${prompt}
The rules are as simple as sunshine. Smilebringer's honor!
When I give you the word, run to each of the checkpoints we've set up in the area. “Smile helpers” are posted at each, so you can't miss them!${prompt}
Talk to the smile helpers and they'll confirm your passage.
The route you take is completely up to you--just be sure you don't miss any checkpoints. You got all that? Hmmm?${prompt}
I'll mark each smile helper's location on your map beforehand, so you don't need to worry about getting lost.${prompt}
Once you've finished visiting all the checkpoints, you have to--you guessed it!--come back and report to me. It's okay, I won't bite!${prompt}

What I will do, though, is tell you how quickly you completed the course. After all, to a smilebringer, speed is everything. Some folks run faster with a fell beast hot on their tail, but we smilebringers need no more than the thought of a child's laughter to spur us on! Zoom zoom!${prompt}

Oh, and I should mention that at this time of year, we're collecting donations in the form of a small fee to participate in the training. All proceeds go towards presents for the children during the Starlight Celebration. Thank you for your cooperation!${prompt}
One more thing you should know. If you venture out of the area, the training will automatically be canceled.
But I can trust you not to walk out on your favorite smile sergeant, right? Hmmm?
And the name of the greased lightning who set this record is ${entity: 0}. Don't be forgetting that, you hear?${prompt}
Awww... You've made this smile sergeant very sad...
But I'll be glued to this spot, because I just know you'll be back to turn my frown upside down! Yes siree!
At this time of year, we're collecting a donation of ${number: 6} gil from each participant.
All proceeds go towards presents for the children. Oh, won't you think of the children? <Sniffle>...${prompt}
Give to the children?
${selection-lines}
I live to give!
Charity begins at home.${prompt}
But of course! First, I'll need you to lend me your ${keyitem-singular: 7[2]}...
Oh, don't pout! I'll give it back as soon as I'm done, promise!${prompt}
You'll find each of the ten smile helpers by the points I've indicated.
Don't forget to talk with every one of them or it won't count, okay?${prompt}
There! I've marked each smile helper's location for you.
If you ever lose your bearings in the middle of a run, just open up your map and everything will be aaall right. Trust me! <Wink>${prompt}
So, are you ready-steady?
${choice: 0}[Beginner/Intermediate/Advanced] level training...GO!
Come on, pump those legs like there's no tomorrow!
Since the Starlight Celebration has ended, we've had to make a few changes.${prompt}
But the Smilebringer Boot Camp will be available for off-season conditioning the whole year round, so come back whenever you're in the mood. I'll be waiting for you!
Oh, you're back! I was afraid we'd lost you to some foul creature prowling the wilderness.
Let's start from the top, shall we?
Oh, what're you doing here? Aren't you in the middle of a run right now?
Couldn't stand to be parted from your favorite smile sergeant, maybe? Teehee!${prompt}
What will you do?
${selection-lines}
Hear an explanation.
Where're the smile helpers again?
Cancel the training.
Nothing.${prompt}
Awww... These rivulets of tears streaming down my face...
B-but it's okay... You have your own reasons for quitting, and I understand... <Sob>
Welcome back! Let's check your time, shall we?
Oh my Goddess! You've set a new record for this area!
Hooray! Somebody, break out the fireworks!${prompt}
You've successfully qualified! Yay!
Here's a little something to commemorate this marvelous achievement.${prompt}
You obtain ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}!
Ah, just the knowledge that there're capable adventurers like you around helps me sleep better at night.
The children...they're in good hands... <Sob>${prompt}
You did just fine, but don't be resting on those laurels, you hear?
As we smilebringers say, there's always a bigger, brighter smile to be had!
Oh no! I'm afraid your time falls short of qualification!
As much as I want to give you a passing grade, headquarters wouldn't let me hear the end of it.
Oh no! Please don't be mad, but...I forgot to record your time.
I hope you'll find it in your heart to forgive this scatterbrain of a smile sergeant...
It might surprise you to learn this, but even the toughest--grrrrrr!--and roughest of us smilebringers need rest and relaxation.
Oh, wipe that grin off your face! I knew you wouldn't believe me!${prompt}
Aaanyway! What I meant to say is, “work hard, play hard” is our motto, and it applies to boot camp participants, too.
After you complete a run with a qualifying time--yay!--you're required to rest up until the next day (Vana'diel time).${prompt}
Awww, seeing the way you're simply bursting with enthusiasm makes me want to cry tears of joy.
But you have to be cruel to be kind. No more training until tomorrow, young ${choice-player-gender}[man/lady]! No siree!

Grrr! Damn this chafing sensation!${prompt}
Hm? Why, th-that stone you bear...${prompt}
Am I correct in assuming that you're ${name-player}?${prompt}
Are you ${name-player}?
${selection-lines}
The one and only!
...${prompt}
Truly!?${prompt}
My name is Ragemont, and I was told that you might show--${prompt}
Aaargh! C-confound it!${prompt}
I must ask you to disregard these abrupt outbursts.
This pain is an inseparable part of inter-dimensional travel.${prompt}
Though I'm made to understand that people of this world do not experience it.${prompt}
Oh, you've not been informed? Then it would be my pleasure to explain.${prompt}
In crossing over to this world, residents of Abyssea suffer from a phenomenon wherein their strength is halved.
“Devivification,” 'tis called, though the exact science of it remains beyond our fathoming.${prompt}
Curiously, the reverse is known to occur when people of your world cross over to ours.${prompt}
And it is exactly for this reason that you're so important in our struggle.
Only with the help of your enhanced powers could we hope to subdue the Abyssean menace and set the world to rights.${prompt}
Ah, but I do ramble. Should you have any questions, my knowledge is at your disposal.${prompt}
What will you ask about?
${selection-lines}
Devivification.
The reverse effect.
Nothing in particular.${prompt}
As I had mentioned prior, the journey here from Abyssea causes our strength to become halved.${prompt}
In practice, it's as if we're in a constant state of weakness.
Adding insult to injury, an unbearable chafing sensation assails us without warning.${prompt}
Sounds bothersome, doesn't it? Yet we do what we must.
The pain that ensues after each crossing compares not to the eternal death of our world.${prompt}
Not everyone is possessed of the ability to traverse dimensions, mind you.
How it's decided that one child will be born with the gift but not another, mortals such as ourselves may never learn the truth of it.${prompt}
No rewards for guessing correctly, but the reverse effect is referred to as “vivification.”
The process can be described in terms of plants.${prompt}
Imagine yourself as a sapling, and Abyssea a pot many times larger than you're accustomed to, filled with humus-rich soil.
As the sapling thrives in such an auspicious environment, blooming forth with flowers beauteous and many, so too will your strength and abilities flourish in Abyssea.${prompt}
Only those of your world with the ability to cross over to ours may attain the strength that is needed to battle the Abyssean hordes.
Do you understand now why your aid is so valuable to us?${prompt}
I see...${prompt}
Ah, yes. With regards to the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}...${prompt}
Beyond this cavernous maw lies another La Theine Plateau, though you will find little resemblance beyond the name.${prompt}
I must say, it eases the heart to stand beneath a sky that isn't a constant and bloody reminder of encroaching death...${prompt}
Ah, once again I must apologize. I am wont to become lost in such sentimental thoughts on occasion.${prompt}
The La Theine of Abyssea is no longer the picturesque, tranquil plateau we stand upon. Seeing its former beauty restored is my fervent desire.${prompt}
There exists an Abyssean monster that has been a great scourge to us--a Gigas of fearsome stature and savagery who dons a golden helm.${prompt}
Defeating this creature would be tantamount to laying the foundation stones for our dreams of peace.${prompt}
Yet a foundation requires many a heavy stone to be laid if a sturdy tower is to be built.
More often than not, though, it feels as if we go about constructing this tower of dreams bereft of an architectural plan.${prompt}
And so we come to this world, seeking the aid of brave souls such as you.
By ourselves, we stand not a sliver of a chance against the Abyssean hordes.${prompt}
Egads, I've lost track of time yet again. I must away before I'm missed.
Before I take my leave, however, I would offer you a few words of advice.${prompt}
You are not alone. There are others of this world who have been blessed with the same gift as you.${prompt}
And do tread warily when first you set foot on Abyssean soil. For though our worlds may bear some resemblance, the difference may well determine life and death.${prompt}
'Til we meet again...fare you well!${prompt}
...${prompt}
${color-alt: 15}The stranger stares intently at ${name-player}.
You must be ${name-player}.${prompt}
The name's Oak. Knotty Oak.${prompt}
I know you're expecting to see Ragemont, but I'm afraid he won't be coming by anymore.${prompt}
He saved my life in battle, but paid for it with his own. For this gift, I intend to carry on his legacy.${prompt}
I've heard of your exploits in our world, ${name-player}.
You've proven yourself a true friend to the cause. Thank you.${prompt}
Now this isn't much, but I think you'll find it useful.${prompt}
${lettercase: 1}${keyitem-article: 0[2]}. Foreign-dimensioners are known to have an affinity for it.${prompt}
Whether we've gotten closer to fulfilling Ragemont's wish, no one can say.${prompt}
But I believe that his meeting with you will count for something.${prompt}
Sorry, but I was never good with words.${prompt}
This is one peaceful world you got here. It's good to see exactly what it is we're fighting to reclaim...${prompt}
Arrrg. Fancy seein' someone in these parts.${prompt}
Hmm? Would ye happen t' be ${name-player}, by any chance?${prompt}
Passin' strange... Thought I'd recognize ye on sight, but perhaps age has clouded me eye.
Now that we finally meet, though, I do sense somethin' diff'rent about ye.${prompt}
Ye're wonderin' how I discern such things, aye?
Well, a man don't live t' me age without learnin' a trick or two...although experience don't account fer all, t' be fair.${prompt}
What's the matter? Ye look like ye've just been t' Davy Jones's locker an' back.${prompt}
Let me take a wild stab: ye're acquainted with the me o' this world.
Aye, ye've got an exprrression that says “I know what ye know, matey.”${prompt}
Hmm... Curse me fer a fool father, but that sparkle o' determination in yer eyes puts me in mind o' me dear daughter.${prompt}
It seems I've gone an' taken leave o' me mannerrrs, like folk o' me trade are wont t' do.${prompt}
Thank ye fer makin' the journey here.

Name's Gilgamesh. I be in the business o' liberrratin' cargo from those as don't need it an' givin' it to those who do--usually meself an' me boys. Call it philanthropy. Or call it piracy if ye like.${prompt}

Nothin' compares t' glidin' upon the waves on the high seas, feelin' the caress o' the wind as she fills yer sails with her sweet brrreath. Aye, the unfettered life o' a pirate be the life fer me.${prompt}
But all o' that an' more was taken away when me world Abyssea took grievously ill.${prompt}
Aye, everythin' we knew crumbled away like ol' hard tack what even the ship rats won't touch. An' it got me t' thinkin'. Piratin' be tough when t'ain't no more merchants what needs piratin'.
So I volunteered me services t' the resistance effort, wantin' to do me part fer mankind, ye see. I be an officer, in fact...${prompt}
That be when the rumors o' ye first reached me, ${name-player}.
The lil' mistress had heard o' ye, too, an' assigned me the task o' measurrrin' yer suitability. So here I be.${prompt}
Ask about...
${selection-lines}
Rumors.
The lil' mistress.
Suitability.${prompt}
Yer right audacious feats in our ravaged world've earned ye considerable renown, matey.
Thanks t' yer exploits, survivors across areas've learned o' each other's existence. Unity o' purpose is startin' t' be seen again.${prompt}
Truth be told, stubborn as we were, at first it was difficult fer us t' admit that we needed outside help t' survive.${prompt}
But prrride offers small comfort when loved ones are dyin' in yer arms.
So we swallowed it, in order t' begin our arduous journey towards salvation.${prompt}
A long an' uncertain road lies ahead, t' be sure, but with the aid o' brave souls such as ye, we'll get t' our destination yet.${prompt}
Ye be curious about who I meant by “the lil' mistress”?
Sorry, matey, but that information ain't mine t' sharrre. Arrrg.${prompt}
No need t' fret, though, 'cause I've got a feelin' ye'll get t' meet the lady soon enough.${prompt}
Takin' another wild stab, might be ye're already acquainted with her in this worrrld, much like ye know me.
Though this be simple speculation, mind ye.${prompt}
T' spare ye the suspense, ye've passed with flyin' colors, matey.${prompt}

Navigatin' Abyssea like it were yer own lil' pond, smitin' beasties that'd shame all the horrors o' the sea like they're no more'n guppies--takes uncommon courage an' a healthy dose o' foolhardiness.${prompt}
Aye, ye be a regular swashbuckler, I reckon.${prompt}
There be one among us come from the old Federation, an eccentric but likeable fellow.

His field o' interest be the boundary between worlds, which he claims is gettin' t' be about as stable as an ol' sea dog w' two peg legs, an' it don't get much more unstable 'n that, matey. Ye ever heard o' such a thing?${prompt}
Multiple dimensions exist in a single world, ye see, places similar yet different.

Knowin' this, the notion that there be things the eye can't see becomes easier t' swallow, aye? Kinda like takin' a nice, long swig from me tankarrrd t' wash down the foul herbal remedy fer me heartburn. But that be a tale fer another day.${prompt}
Gettin' back on topic, the boundary be growin' unstable, ever since the dimensions synchronized...or so I be told.
Can ye imagine such a phenomenon? Are ye still even followin' what I'm sayin'? 'Cause, blimey, even I ain't sure I follow meself sometimes.${prompt}
I don't claim full understandin' o' all this, but it don't take no atma infusionist t' see there be a problem.
Aye, even a boorish pirate such as meself can tell when all hell's brrroken loose.${prompt}
What's any o' this got t' do with yer suitability, ye ask? Why, everything, matey!

Our world's been fair turned into a disaster zone, an' we need mettlesome folk who won't get all squeamish when confrontin' the mess. And by me measurin' stick, ye surpass that requirement by a nautical malm.${prompt}
Keep in mind, though, that it's all over if ye die. Ye've got just the one life, so careful what ye do with it.

These words must seem hollow, comin' from the selfsame bastarrrd who's askin' ye t' dive headlong into danger. But we've already lost enough things we care fer. The gods be damned if we lose any more.${prompt}

Arrrg, but I ramble. I fear me mind's become much given t' wanderlust in old age. Resistin' the urge t' go off on a tangent or state the bleedin' obvious be about as hard as resistin' the call o' drink. Ye'll have t' bear with me.${prompt}
Durin' me piratin' days, I saw many a thing n' more. “Arrrg, there be nothin' left in the world that could surprise this sea dog,” I'd often boast.${prompt}
But then the earth crumbled an' the skies turned a bloody red, leavin' this brrraggart as dumbstruck an' clueless as a bleedin' lan'lubber gawpin' o'er an anchor hitch.${prompt}
So fer all me yappin', I've really got nothin' useful t' share with ye. At least not fer the time bein'.
The lil' mistress, however, she be a veritable treasure trove o' knowledge, aye.${prompt}
Why do I know so little, ye ask?
Why, that be a question o' readiness t' face the truth o' things, matey. Fer me, it seems the time's yet t' come.${prompt}

Earlier, I told ye o' me involvement with the resistance. But truth be told, it's all this retired pirate can do t' keep himself an' those around him alive. All o' us have things we're bound t' prrrotect, after all.${prompt}
It shames me t' no end, havin' t' rely on the kindness o' selfless folk like yerself...but there be no help fer it.${prompt}
Fact is, yer aid will be o' far greater worth t' the lil' mistress than what me folk an' I could ever muster up.${prompt}
But don't be presumin' that we mean t' sit idly by, scratchin' our bum cheeks.
Yer courageous exploits have instilled much needed morale within the survivors, an' they stand rrready t' fight again.${prompt}
The real battle starts from here, an' mankind ain't goin' down without a struggle, this I promise ye.
Whatever bloodlust drives those vile creatures, we'll match it an' more with our will t' live.${prompt}
Shiver me timbers, would ye look at the time? I must be headin' back before I'm missed.
Be a good ${choice-player-gender}[lad/lass] an' pass me regards t' Joachim, would ye?${prompt}
I look forward t' our next meetin', ${name-player}.
I promise t' cork up me rrramblin' then. Arrrg.${prompt}
Ahoy there, matey. Hope I didn't make ye wait overlong.${prompt}
Truth be told, I didn't imagine we'd need t' meet again so soon.${prompt}
I bring grim news, ${name-player}. Urgent tidings that wants fer tellin'.${prompt}
After regainin' contact with the survivorrrs, we got them conductin' thorough investigations in their respective locales.${prompt}
With yer keen eyes, ye've no doubt already noticed the disfigured Abyssean landscape.
At first we all assumed the earthquake t' be the culprit, the one that shook the earth that fateful day.${prompt}
But as we just discovered, that be not the case. The root o' the problem runs far deeper than all imaginin'.${prompt}
I didn't mention it at our last meetin', but once I had the pleasure o' workin' with a bunch fondly referred t' as the “Champions o' Abyssea.”${prompt}
A good-hearted lot they were, always tirelessly scurrin' about, gettin' things done behind the scenes.${prompt}
Once, I asked them what be their drrrivin' force. An' how do ye imagine they responded? With naught but a mischievous grin! Hah!
A right mysterious bunch they were, as many an' unique as the fishes in the sea.${prompt}
So...uh...not ringin' any bells? Well, small wonder, what with me penchant fer incoherent bletherin'.
Let me put it in a way right-minded folk'll understand: in yer world Vana'diel, the Champions o' Abyssea be ye adventurers. Aye, ye included, matey.${prompt}
Durin' yer time in Abyssea, ye've surely met folk who also exist in yer world.
However, ye've yet t' meet yerself. Have ye ever given thought t' why that is?${prompt}
The answer be remarrrkably simple. Ye don't exist in that world no more.
The reason be not known t' me, I'm afeared. One day, we simply lost contact with ye.${prompt}
Any one o' a thousand things could've happened t' cause yer disappearance, matey.
An' the possibilities be multiplied when I be in me cups, arrrg.${prompt}
But no use dwellin' on it right now. It's high time we be gettin' back t' the topic o' the investigation.${prompt}
One change o' particular note was reported: there be places where the land's breakin' down in a lattice pattern.${prompt}
This phenomenon be happenin' throughout the realm, matey, on a level so subtle it'd escape the notice o' untrrrained eyes.${prompt}
The skies turnin' a bloody red... Endless swarms o' beasties crawlin' out o' dark crevasses...
The world's undergone changes never b'fore seen by mankind.${prompt}
Yet...I can't help but feel that these be piddlin' lil' things compared t' what's on the horizon.${prompt}
Mere droplets from the keg that's about t' be upturned over our heads.
The wind b'fore the squall. A ramblin', disjointed preamble b'fore the--${prompt}
Ahem! Well, I think ye get the point.
So, this trepidation be eatin' away at me insides, matey, an' I can't stand it no more.${prompt}
I've rrresolved t' seek the answers from the lil' mistress--ask her all she knows about what's befallen our world, an' what horrors are still t' come.${prompt}
Whether I be ready t' deal with the truth, I can't say.${prompt}
But the fate o' the world won't wait on the readiness o' one man.
Fer better or fer worse, I must go an' do this thing.${prompt}
Arrrg, looks like me cursed mouth found a will o' its own once again.
I sure as hell hope I haven't put ye off future meetings between us, matey.${prompt}
Fer now, fare ye well.${prompt}

Periapt.${prompt}

The Voidwatch is a fellowship of men and women come together to defend the world from extradimensional invaders called “Voidwalkers.” Driven only by an insatiable appetite for destruction, these fell horrors roam the space between dimensions, ever seeking to enter and plunge Vana'diel into chaos.${prompt}
Faced with the risk of mass invasion, Voidwatch leaders devised a strategy wherein potential threats are preemptively neutralized.
This act was made possible through the discovery of voidstones, magicked objects capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible to be summarily dispatched.${prompt}
Such efforts to stem the rise of Voidwalkers, collectively dubbed “Voidwatch Operations,” or “Ops” for short, take place in the vicinity of planar rifts--weak points in the fabric of space.${prompt}

A single person may initiate a Voidwatch operation, at which time “Voidwatcher” status will be bestowed upon all qualifying party and alliance members, allowing them to commence battle with the target Voidwalker.${prompt}

Voidwatch Ops are subject to a time limit. Exceed this limit and Voidwatcher status will be revoked for all involved, bringing the confrontation to an end. Individuals straying too far from the site of battle, too, will find themselves relieved of the status.${prompt}
Know also that those who take on the burden of the Voidwatcher become temporarily isolated and unable to receive aid from the outside world.
Such is the arduous nature of transdimensional encounters.${prompt}
Initiating a Voidwatch operation requires a voidstone, as well as a stratum abyssite attuned to a particular planar rift.${prompt}
Only one person needs to be in possession of these objects for all party and alliance members to participate.${prompt}
However, there exists a number of participation conditions that must be observed.${prompt}
When an operation commences, a single voidstone will be expended for all who possess it.
These combatants will have the opportunity to improve their spoils by manipulating spectral alignment values during battle.${prompt}
Conversely, those not possessing their own voidstone will be limited in the spoils they can obtain.${prompt}
The “voidstone” is a magicked object which, when coupled with stratum abyssite, is capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible.${prompt}
Only a single combatant need possess a voidstone to allow all party and alliance members to participate in a Voidwatch operation.
Those without one, however, will find their spoils limited in both quantity and quality.${prompt}
As a single voidstone is automatically expended when the battle commences, it is recommended that you keep stock of your inventory.${prompt}
Those wishing to obtain the stones should speak to a Voidwatch officer, who is charged with issuing a set quantity at fixed intervals.${prompt}
Stratum abyssite are dynamic stones capable of evolution. By absorbing the energies emitted by felled Voidwalkers, they become attuned with other planar rifts.${prompt}
After defeating your quarry, present your stone to an atmacite refiner--specialists in the study of otherworld geology--to have its properties determined.${prompt}
Stratum abyssite growth occurs independently of voidstones, and the latter is not required to trigger development.${prompt}

Each dimension is composed of its own existential spectrum to which objects of that world are aligned. The act of rendering a Voidwalker visible is essentially an act of aligning oneself to its existential spectrum.${prompt}

While Voidwatchers are able to, for all practical purposes, interact with such creatures, they in fact fall short of full alignment. Symptoms of this imperfect state can be observed in the limited quantity and quality of spoils normally yielded by Voidwalkers.${prompt}

Compensating measures, however, exist which allow combatants to more closely attune themselves with their extradimensional foe. One such method involves the use of alignment-enhancing artifacts known as “ascent items.”${prompt}
Alignment values raised through ascent items will remain in place until such time as a riftworn pyxis is opened at the end of a successful operation.${prompt}
Those participating in Voidwatch Ops are recommended to plan ahead in order to make effective use of ascent items.${prompt}
Alignment values can also be raised in the midst of battle by striking at enemy weaknesses, causing their existential attunement to shift to your advantage.${prompt}

Blows can be dealt with abilities such as weapon skills and magic spells, and your choice of weakness and the manner in which you strike it will determine which hue of the alignment spectrum is affected.${prompt}
The existential spectrum is comprised of five lights (blue, red, yellow, green, and white), each of which influences reward yield.${prompt}
The precise workings of each light can be reviewed when examining your current alignment values.${prompt}
Upon the successful conclusion of battle, the alignment bonus as granted by ascent items and the exploitation of enemy weaknesses are combined to determine the spoils.${prompt}

Be forewarned: Voidwalkers are highly guileful beings and will not suffer the same weakness being struck twice. Combatants must be on constant watch for any changes that may occur during the course of battle.${prompt}
Atmacite is the physical agglomeration of a monster's soul, and a vessel for its feral instincts.
By infusing atmacite to one's body using ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}, it is possible to enhance one's battle prowess.${prompt}
Be aware, however, that powers granted by atmacite can be tapped only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.${prompt}
Atmacite is resilient and will not be expended in the infusion process.${prompt}
Furthermore, infused atmacite will remain in place until voluntarily purged.${prompt}
As the configuration of atmacite is not possible during an operation, be sure to see to your battle preparations ahead of time.${prompt}
Cruor can be used to enrich atmacite, enhancing its potency. The amount of cruor required for enrichment and the resultant properties vary with atmacite.${prompt}
Atmacite can be enriched in stages to a maximum of level ${number: 0}.${prompt}
All Voidwatchers are urged to make atmacite enrichment a priority, for they might just mean the difference between life and death.${prompt}
Periapt are lucky charms that grant myriad beneficial effects ranging from improved vitality to general upturns in fortune.${prompt}
Especially sought after are those bestowing temporary items at the commencement of an operation, granting combatants a distinct advantage against the enemy.${prompt}
Although their acquisition can only be described as arduous, the benefits make them well worth the effort.${prompt}

The celestial capital of Al'Taieu welcomes you.${prompt}
Would that it would do so with open arms, but the vortex slowly eats away at my home.${prompt}
The capital is not the only thing to succumb. I, too, feel my energy beginning to fade.${prompt}
You are eminently aware that I am not supposed to be present in this haven.${prompt}
The void is compressing time, and things that once remained separate are starting to collide.${prompt}
Perhaps it might be easiest to think of me as a wandering spirit.${prompt}
No, you needn't offer me any explanation.${prompt}

You and Iroha have sought guidance from companions all throughout Vana'diel in order to stop the encroaching darkness.${prompt}
In Iroha's future was an event called “the Reckoning” in which you made a decision that rang throughout the land.${prompt}
As a result, Iroha was left alone, confined to Reisenjima.${prompt}
A future in which Iroha was the only child of Altana left in Vana'diel.${prompt}
And so you wish to beseech Altana herself for guidance...for any hint on how this bleak future can be altered.${prompt}
Al'Taieu is oft referred to as the celestial capital because it has a stronger connection with Altana than anywhere on the ground below.${prompt}

And I am able to commune with the terrestrial avatars and pass through the veil separating this world from the next via the crystal. Yet even I do not possess the means to reach Altana herself.${prompt}
Even the most powerful forces in the lands, forces that can create whole worlds, cannot approach her.${prompt}
Not even Odin.${prompt}
No, such a feat requires more than anyone could hope to muster.${prompt}
A power so great it could make the five crystals whole once more.${prompt}
Yet did the future Siren not mention that a key may yet lie in Reisenjima?${prompt}
I find no cause to doubt her, particularly in light of what I have discovered.${prompt}
What if we could create a crystal that could banish the Emptiness?${prompt}
${name-player}, you have traversed the cavernous maws, so I need not remind you that you have visited worlds other than our own.${prompt}
These worlds exist in parallel, and each has its own past, present, and future.${prompt}
Tartarus, a place known by a select few in Eastern Ulbuka, is one such world.${prompt}

...And have accumulated enough light to create another towering mothercrystal for Vana'diel.${prompt}

Iroha's presence or absence makes no difference.${prompt}
The result would be the same.${prompt}

...${prompt}

Ah, fate hath brought us together once more!
Word of thy deeds reached our hallowed halls, kupo!${prompt}
Hm? Wait a moment, kupo.
Couldst thou be the one we've heard so much about?${prompt}
Oh! It's my magnificent master, kupo!
You have tirelessly toiled on behalf of this world, ${name-player}!${prompt}
Indeed, I have heard much of thy bravery.
They sayeth that thou art to take up the Prime Weapon and wield it to great purpose.${prompt}
Dost thou remember me?
I am Kupofried.${prompt}
I thought so, kupo.
Thou art the one who is to take up the Prime Weapon and wield it to great purpose.${prompt}
Kupokupo.
I am Kupofried.${prompt}
The god of darkness, Odin, hath sent his demon servant to instruct me on how to guide the people of this land.${prompt}
'Tis of no small import that I have summoned thee and this moogle here today.${prompt}
I am afraid that the situation is much more grim than the one five thousand years ago, kupo.${prompt}
Upon its appearance in Valhalla, Chaos was accompanied by the Maelstrom Mage.
Two entities with such power betwixt them is quite the conundrum, kupo.
Chaos draws upon an endless supply of magic from the astral plane...
And then bequeaths that magic unto the Maelstrom Mage so that he can wield various spells, kupo.
Of those spells, thou must be especially careful of his ability to project powerful phantoms.
Thou hast already faced the peril of a phantom of Chaos, yes?${prompt}
The Maelstrom Mage appears to be capable of producing such powerful phantoms endlessly, kupo.${prompt}
Furthermore, he is a masterful manipulator of those who are weak of will.${prompt}
That is why I believe Odin hath ordered that the Maelstrom Mage be defeated first, kupo.${prompt}
However, I fear even that will not be enough.${prompt}
We must also call upon the assistance of the most powerful beastmen to be found in the remote reaches of the land.${prompt}
That's where we come in, kupo!${prompt}
You see, we moogles proudly participated in the battle five thousand years ago.${prompt}
However, we are not particularly potent fighters, kupo.${prompt}
Therefore, we served as messengers so that we could unite the wild and woolly world of beastmen.${prompt}
Unfortunately, the world is faced with the same situation as five thousand years ago.
There is still great animosity between many of them, kupo.${prompt}
It would help our cause greatly if we can forge a bond between them, kupo.${prompt}
Therefore, much like five thousand years ago, we must restore the great kingdom of Kupalika!${prompt}
Hmph. 'Tis not a pursuit where we can afford to make many mistakes.${prompt}
Five thousand years ago, there was a kind and gentle moogle who went by the moniker of Mogustus, kupo.${prompt}
Mogustus was entrusted with the most difficult negotiations.
He frequently found himself surrounded by many hot-tempered beastmen.${prompt}
However, he refused to give up on his task.
Though his pom-pom did not escape unscathed, he was successful in his rather earnest endeavor.${prompt}
After the battle, Mogustus was accepted by many of the beastmen and none dared to attack him again, kupo.${prompt}
It served as a promise of peace and prosperity.
And that is how the moogle kingdom of Kupalika was founded.${prompt}
However...${prompt}
A great struggle erupted betwixt us moogles...${prompt}
Our kingdom, one born through the forging of powerful bonds, was doomed to failure once its own internal bonds bitterly broke.${prompt}
Yes, such bonds are incredibly important, kupo.${prompt}
Forgive my failing of focus, but I need thee to understand, kupo.
Thou must understand what is truly important.${prompt}
I know! We must reforge the broken bonds so that we can all come together once more, kupo!${prompt}
To that end, there is something we must ask of thee, kupo.${prompt}
There are a number of powerful warriors who have gathered to offer us their amicable assistance.${prompt}
They are currently training in order to take on the Maelstrom Mage and Chaos, kupo.${prompt}
However, there is a group of belligerent beastmen among them that refuse to fight by your side...${prompt}
No moogles nor even myself hath been able to convince them otherwise, kupo.${prompt}
Kupopo!?
They refused you too, King Kupofried!?${prompt}
Indeed. I believe our only hope is for the two of you to personally plead our case to them.${prompt}
“The two of you”?
You wish for me to accompany ${name-player}, kupo!?${prompt}
Yes, you have both known each other for some time now.
You are acutely aware of each other's strengths, kupo.${prompt}
Yes, you're right!
I promise to do my best, kupo!${prompt}
I ask that ye be careful.
Thine encounter may go beyond mere words and require immediate intervention.${prompt}

King Kupofried, where should the moogles go?${prompt}
Very well! Leave it to me, kupo!${prompt}
Now then, we must arrange to meet up.${prompt}
Let's head to the bottom of the cliffs to the south of here, kupo.${prompt}

It can be a most treacherous trek!${prompt}
I'll go on ahead, kupo!
You must pass through Ordelle's Caves and head to the meeting place at the bottom of the cliffs in the La Theine Plateau.${prompt}
Ugago! Gugagoh!${prompt}
Yeah, I agree!
Why should we listen to what people have to say!?${prompt}
(Give me Prime Weapon!)${prompt}
...!${prompt}

Master!
We need your help here, kupo!${prompt}

Yes, the very same adventurer responsible for restoring the legendary Prime Weapon, kupo!${prompt}
Gogoah! Gegge ugaguoga!
Kupo?

Kupopo!
That's easy for you to say!${prompt}

Nobody but my marvelous master here, that is!${prompt}
Do you see what I'm saying?

However, it is the courage to suddenly stray from the path that leads to new discoveries, kupo.${prompt}

(I understand what you say, but...)${prompt}

Kupo! Why don't you get it!?

(Joining forces require strong hero.)${prompt}

It is the only way!${prompt}
Kupokupo!!!
M-Master!

Gugah...

Kupo...
